title: Magnavox Odyssey Released
description: The first commercial home video game console launches, beginning the video game revolution.

title: Atari 2600 Transforms Gaming
description: The Atari 2600 introduces cartridge-based gaming, allowing players to own multiple games for one console.

title: Pac-Man Arcade Phenomenon
description: Pac-Man becomes a cultural icon, expanding gaming's appeal beyond traditional demographics.

title: Nintendo Famicom Launches in Japan
description: Nintendo's Family Computer (Famicom) revitalizes the gaming industry after the 1983 crash.

title: NES Launches in North America
description: The Nintendo Entertainment System brings gaming back to American homes with strict quality control.

title: Super Mario Bros. Revolutionizes Platformers
description: Shigeru Miyamoto's masterpiece sets new standards for game design and becomes an enduring franchise.

title: The Legend of Zelda Creates Open-World Gaming
description: Zelda introduces non-linear gameplay and battery-backed save systems, changing adventure games forever.

title: Sega Genesis Enters the Market
description: Sega's 16-bit console challenges Nintendo's dominance with 'blast processing' and edgier marketing.

title: Super Nintendo Entertainment System Arrives
description: Nintendo's 16-bit powerhouse features Mode 7 graphics and defines the console wars of the early 90s.

title: Sonic the Hedgehog Speeds onto Scene
description: Sega's blue mascot brings attitude and speed-based gameplay, becoming a cultural phenomenon.

title: Sony PlayStation Enters Gaming
description: Sony's first console uses CD-ROMs and 3D graphics, attracting mature audiences and third-party developers.

title: Nintendo 64 Brings Analog Control
description: The N64 introduces the analog stick for 3D movement and delivers groundbreaking titles.

title: Super Mario 64 Defines 3D Platforming
description: Mario's leap into 3D establishes the camera and control conventions still used today.

title: Final Fantasy VII Showcases Cinematic Gaming
description: Square's epic RPG demonstrates the storytelling potential of games with pre-rendered cinematics.

title: PlayStation 2 Becomes Best-Selling Console
description: Sony's DVD-playing powerhouse achieves unprecedented market dominance with 155+ million units sold.

title: Microsoft Xbox Introduces Online Gaming
description: Xbox Live brings unified online gaming to consoles with voice chat and matchmaking.

title: Nintendo GameCube Launches
description: Nintendo's compact console features innovative controller design and first-party excellence.

title: Xbox 360 Pioneers HD Gaming
description: Microsoft's second console establishes achievements, digital downloads, and HD graphics as standards.

title: Nintendo Wii Revolutionizes Motion Control
description: The Wii's motion controls attract casual gamers and expand the gaming demographic dramatically.

title: PlayStation 3 Introduces Blu-ray
description: Sony's Cell processor and Blu-ray drive push technical boundaries despite a rocky launch.

title: Wii U Introduces Dual-Screen Gaming
description: Nintendo's tablet controller concept struggles commercially but innovates asymmetric gameplay.

title: PlayStation 4 Dominates Generation
description: Sony's gamer-focused approach and exclusive titles make PS4 the generation's best-seller.

title: Xbox One Launches with Multimedia Focus
description: Microsoft's all-in-one entertainment system pivots to gaming after initial backlash.

title: Nintendo Switch Blends Home and Portable
description: The hybrid console's flexibility and strong first-party lineup revitalizes Nintendo's fortunes.

title: PlayStation 5 Ushers in Ray Tracing Era
description: Sony's latest console features SSD speeds and haptic feedback for next-gen immersion.

title: Xbox Series X/S Focus on Game Pass
description: Microsoft's twin consoles emphasize backward compatibility and subscription gaming.
